connector.description: Send email through the Amazon Simple Email Service (SES).

camel.kamelet.aws-ses-sink.accessKey.name: camel.kamelet.aws-ses-sink.accessKey
camel.kamelet.aws-ses-sink.accessKey.description: The access key obtained from AWS.

camel.kamelet.aws-ses-sink.secretKey.name: camel.kamelet.aws-ses-sink.secretKey
camel.kamelet.aws-ses-sink.secretKey.description: The secret key obtained from AWS.

camel.kamelet.aws-ses-sink.useDefaultCre.name: camel.kamelet.aws-ses-sink.useDefaultCredentialsProvider
camel.kamelet.aws-ses-sink.useDefaultCre.description: If true, the SES client loads credentials through a default credentials provider. If false, it uses the basic authentication method (access key and secret key).

camel.kamelet.aws-ses-sink.useProfileCre.name: camel.kamelet.aws-ses-sink.useProfileCredentialsProvider
camel.kamelet.aws-ses-sink.useProfileCre.description: Set whether the SES client should expect to load credentials through a profile credentials provider.

camel.kamelet.aws-ses-sink.useSessionCre.name: camel.kamelet.aws-ses-sink.useSessionCredentials
camel.kamelet.aws-ses-sink.useSessionCre.description: Set whether the SES client should expect to use Session Credentials. This is useful in situation in which the user needs to assume a IAM role for doing operations in SES.

camel.kamelet.aws-ses-sink.profileCreden.name: camel.kamelet.aws-ses-sink.profileCredentialsName
camel.kamelet.aws-ses-sink.profileCreden.description: If using a profile credentials provider this parameter will set the profile name.

camel.kamelet.aws-ses-sink.sessionToken.name: camel.kamelet.aws-ses-sink.sessionToken
camel.kamelet.aws-ses-sink.sessionToken.description: Amazon AWS Session Token used when the user needs to assume a IAM role.
